sentences.en: A reduced standard of living will develop from increasing taxation and rising unemployment.
sentences.cn: 捐税的增长和失业人数的上升将会导致生活水平的降低.

sentences.en: Compensation could be made by adjustments to taxation.
sentences.cn: 通过调整税收可以作出补偿。

sentences.en: Employment and taxation are the bread-and-butter issues of politics.
sentences.cn: 就业和征税是很重要的政治问题。

sentences.en: He is running for mayor on a platform of low taxation.
sentences.cn: 他以低税收为纲领竞选市长.

sentences.en: He made a number of simplifications in the taxation system.
sentences.cn: 他在税制上作了一些简化.

sentences.en: It's good that he used direct taxation rather than stealth taxes to raise the money.
sentences.cn: 还好他采用了直接征税而不是间接征税的手段来筹集资金。

sentences.en: Mr Simon said he was not against taxes as such, "but I do object when taxation is justified on spurious or dishonest grounds," he says.
sentences.cn: 西蒙先生说他对税收本身并不反对，“但是我反对以虚假不实的理由巧立明目收税，”他说。

sentences.en: Taxation is not popular in principle, merely acceptable in context.
sentences.cn: 征税基本上是不受欢迎的，在一定情境中才勉强为人接受。

sentences.en: the government’s economic and taxation policy
sentences.cn: 政府的经济和税收政策

sentences.en: The increase in indirect taxation is intended to neutralise the reduction in income tax.
sentences.cn: 增加间接税是为了抵消所得税的减少.

sentences.en: The result will be higher taxation.
sentences.cn: 结果将是征收更高的税。

sentences.en: There are plans afoot to increase taxation.

words.tran_cn: [税收] 可课税性；可征税性
